definitions.definition: To fail, to cease to function.
definitions.example: I am afraid my computer will break down if I try to run it at too high a speed.

definitions.definition: To render or to become unstable due to stress, to collapse physically or mentally.
definitions.example: She is back to work now, after she broke down the other day.

definitions.definition: To render or to become weak and ineffective.
definitions.example: His authority and influence over his coordinates broke down gradually.
Leaves and grass will break down into compost faster if you keep them moist.

definitions.definition: To divide into parts to give more details, to provide a more indepth analysis of.
definitions.example: If you don't understand, ask him to break down the numbers for you.
His stomach took a while to break down his food.
